original_data.question: A 17-year-old woman presents to your office concerned that she has not had her menstrual period in 4 months. She states that menses began at age of 13 and has been regular until two months ago. She denies sexual activity, and urine pregnancy test is negative. On exam, she appears well-nourished with a BMI of 21 kg/m^2, but you note that she has enlarged cheeks bilaterally and has calluses on the dorsum of her hands. She says that she has been very stressed with school and has recently been binge eating. What other finding do you expect to see in this patient?

model_response:
This patient has the constellation of findings that suggest the diagnosis of bulimia nervosa. This disorder is characterized by recurrent episodes of binge eating followed by attempts to purge calories through self-induced vomiting, misuse of laxatives or diuretics, or excessive exercise. The result of these activities is a cycle of weight fluctuation that leads to an obsession with weight and body image. The physical exam findings of calluses on the dorsum of the hand are a result of the patient's attempt to induce vomiting by putting her fingers into her mouth and forcibly gagging herself. The enlarged cheeks are due to enlargement of the parotid glands from repeated episodes of sore, inflamed glands due to the patient's self-induced vomiting. The erosion of tooth enamel is due to the excessive exposure of the teeth to stomach acid during repeated vomiting. The malar rash is a characteristic rash seen in patients with bulimia that results from the repeated exposure of the face to the acidic gastric juices during vomiting. The increased blood glucose level is not a feature of this disorder. The elevated estrogen levels are not seen in patients with bulimia.

Answer: OPTION C IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Human females as cultural, psychological, sociological, political, and economic entities.

The periodic shedding of the ENDOMETRIUM and associated menstrual bleeding in the MENSTRUAL CYCLE of humans and primates. Menstruation is due to the decline in circulating PROGESTERONE, and occurs at the late LUTEAL PHASE when LUTEOLYSIS of the CORPUS LUTEUM takes place.

One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
A constituent administrative district of a nation.

How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.

An absence finding of the specified component / analyte, organism or clinical sign based on the established threshold of the performed test or procedure.

\[Note: Negative does not necessarily imply the complete absence of the specified item.\]
An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a clinician that is based on a physical exam, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.
The part of the face that is below the eye and to the side of the nose and mouth.
Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.
The rear surface of an upright primate from the shoulders to the hip, or the dorsal surface of tetrapods.
The distal part of the arm beyond the wrist in humans and primates, that includes the palm, fingers, and thumb.
The negative mental, emotional, and physical reactions that occur when environmental stressors are perceived as exceeding the individual's adaptive capacities.
Eating an excess amount of food in a short period of time, as seen in the disorder of BULIMIA NERVOSA. It is caused by an abnormal craving for food, or insatiable hunger also known as "ox hunger".
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
